content.description:
A fun eliminate - number 1 on

1. The Wrath of Kahan 5.10d 2. Potholes 5.9 3. Potholes Escape  5.7 4. Potholes Crack 5.9

.

Steeply up to an impasse, right to the verge of Potholes, then up, the crux involves gaining a small ledge on the left of the buttress.

Quite strenuous.

climbs.name: Walk the Plank
climbs.fa: Peter Hayes, John Yablonski & Mike Guardino, 1989

content.description: This top-rope is located to the left of Vicious. Two variations to the routes exist.
content.protection: Bolts are located on top. bring lots of webbing.

content.description: 3 bolt anchor with a directional to the right so you can TR the variation to Vicious.

Usually started right of Potholes Crack, but can be started at the left side of the Wall.

Fingery and strenuous through to a crazy final move.
content.location: Left side of the Back Wall

content.description:
Follow the crack up and over the overlap. The crux move would be getting over the overlap.  Great cardio pump climb with a lot of sustained moves.

This is a very good climb to enhance your skills if you are starting to crack climb.
content.protection: Take the trail to the left to set up a top rope anchor. An equalized set of nuts and a hex or two will work out fine,  you can also just sling the boulder on top. This route can also be led.
content.location: Left buttress of the Back Wall.

content.description:
The steep get steeper!

A way fun route up the big solution pockets to the moment of truth almost right at the top which, surprisingly, can be finessed rather than brute forced - don't forget to finish this off with the obligatory Stoney mantle move.
content.location: Left buttress of the Back Wall.

content.description: Same start as potholes traverse but stay low. 2 crux moves earn this route itâ€™s 4/5 rating. One is moving into the big side pull, the other being the HUGE reach (shorter climbers will have their face on the wall) and catching the crimp with a high foot. End on the circular crimp before the tree.
content.protection: No pad needed, but if you want one for the lean, it will be helpful if your hands blow.
content.location: Just under potholes traverse. Start just to the right of the crack and move to the tree on the right.

climbs.name: Dart Lady
climbs.fa: Mike Waugh & Bill Leventhal in 1986 or 1987

content.description: Straight up the middle of Potholes traverse.
content.protection: 3 bolts are located on a small ledge next to a shrub. to get to anchors bring a second cord or webbing to rap ("batman") down to 3bolts.

content.description:
Just to the right of Potholes Crack on the Back Wall. Staying right of the crack on the face all the way up You start out on crimps and two backsteps five feet right of the crack, then climb up and left. . Gotta hook the tip of your thumb to step onto some crimps, then you move into the crux in which all of your weight is on just your left toe and your right hand with your right foot flagging so you're sideways (looks cool). After the crux you're in a rest position doing the splits (looks cool), then it's an under cling and two crimps to get over the bulge. It takes a very creative sequence.

David was thinking of Banana Split since you have to do the splits on the route, but to mark the occasion of Charles' Tozan's move to Florida in a few weeks, he went with "Charles Split."
content.protection: Lead on 1 1/2 to 3 inch cams walk off the back side, or this can be Top Roped off the anchor on Potholes Crack.
content.location: Located on the back wall just right of Pothole's Crack on the face.

content.description:
Kinda gets your attention...

A funky steep start leads to a good flake, then pure jams to exit onto the easier top part of Beehive Chimney.
content.protection: Toprope problem - boulder and cams for anchor.
content.location: Steep crack left of Beehive Chimney.

content.description: Good holds and easy angle in the chimney lead to the slabby ramp - after this things get technical; up a steep corner crack somewhat reminiscent of Red Rocks, and lots of fun.
content.location: The right-most crack on the Back Wall is in fact this chimney.

content.description: crack  climbers delight until you hit the sandy pin scars. this thing can be done with pins,however try to chalk it up as much as you can.
Up the right trending ramp to the moment of truth, very steeply up the crack to a butt ledge rest - the crux follows, a tenuous lieback to easier ground.
content.protection: Toprope problem (or scary lead) - boulder and cams, and one not excellent bolt.
content.location: Two diagonal cracks form an A-Frame shape - this is the right crack.
